thread.title: Diners cheer for Obamas and Bono at NYC lunch | Page Six
thread.title_full: Diners cheer for Obamas and Bono at NYC lunch | Page Six

author: Christine Burroni
title: Diners cheer for Obamas and Bono at NYC lunch | Page Six
text:
Talk about a power lunch.
Bono joined Barack and Michelle Obama at Stephen Starr’s restaurant Upland on Friday, and the trio caused quite the stir.
“Everyone in the restaurant knew they were there,” a source told Page Six of patrons who were tipped off by “tons” of Secret Service in the Gramercy eatery. “There was a major buzz in the air.”
The former first couple and the U2 frontman ate in a private dining room downstairs for a “casual lunch” — with no way of avoiding crowds, as they had to walk though the main dining area to get to their table. Bono and the former president entered first and Michelle followed behind.
We’re told Barack Obama “flashed his million-dollar smile” as he waved to the crowd while exiting the restaurant.
Barack Obama has ventured to New York a few times since leaving office. In February, he and daughter Malia saw “The Price” on Broadway while she’s interning for movie-business bigwig Harvey Weinstein.
